"The push for machine learning and deep learning is growing at an exponential rate but, the world is searching for creative and deep thinkers, the human learners who can create and deliver disruptive value on local, national and global platforms." ~ Onyi Anyado.

author: @HustleLizard

comment:
It seems to me like we are feeding those models with textual data and think we can magically "generate" what we call "intelligence", or even consciousness. The thing is that "intelligence" is not about delivering data, it's about understanding concepts, approaching the truth. Consciousness is about having the concept of self, as opposed to the concept of the world, and having the concept of both being fused together. So it's a much more complex task than just delivering data.

I think that to build AGI we need to think differently that to just feed a model with data. It's really about learning and understanding things, so there must be a process like the one we all lived in our lives, when we were born and learned everything we know from experience; There must be this way of having a "pre-wired" brain, but waiting to be filled with connections that matter to us because they are part of our experience of the world.

So to me, that's the only way we can even think of reaching something close to AGI, but even then, I'm not sure a machine is capable of experience understanding or consciousness because everything it does is based on calculus, and when we experience life and concepts, we ain't calculating anything, our consciousness is on the dimension of ideas itself. But I believe that we could nonetheless reach a very good "intelligence" mimicking maching, that could really fool us into believing it's conscious, and that it "understands" things, because it will be like a mirror of ourselves.

comment:
He is responsible for starting the AGI Arms Race.
Even if none of ClosedAI models ends up destroying humanity, they have caused absolutely outstanding hype and funding that significantly shortens the time left to align true digital intelligence.
We had very little time before, now we likely have hardly any time at all.

Of all the corporations in the world, he has sold humanity to god damned Microsoft! EEE! (While having the audacity to call his company "Open" AI).
I am not calling for open sourcing potentially the most dangerous tech ever (although, at this point, given the funding, I guess it does not matter anyway), but selling it to Microsoft? Wow.

He has gone against all the principles his organization supposedly stood for.
Hope it was all well worth it.

comment:
It would be cool if Open AI would release a non bias non filtered version. Maybe GPT4 is that, I am not able to use it yet.
I have always dreamed of an AI system that I could ask any question and it would be able to answer with extreme accuracy with out political, ideological, or any other bias within reason. I even started working on that system but I am no Sam Altman and I failed so far. I didn't want the system to humor me, I wanted the most accurate approximation of the truth/facts. Mostly for medical reasons.
I guess its going to take some time for that. Every human on earth has bias, its a survival mechanism and we ALL think ours is accurate and other peoples is foobar, how do we get past that.

classification.content: The comment is critical and disapproving of a scientific concept that has some room for debate. It expresses skepticism about the accuracy of certain information, particularly when it comes to controversial topics like origin of the universe. The tone appears to be neutral in its criticism, but the language is somewhat confrontational.
text: Very true,  that is a serious issue.
And some information really has no one truth so to speak of.
And if only false data is recorded, the system will average a bunch of false data.

comment:
Very true,  that is a serious issue. And some information really has no one truth so to speak of. Like ideological, philosophical etc etc. That leans more toward opinions. And if only false data is recorded, the system will average a bunch of false data. Huge problem.
It could work well for physics, medicine, and technology by feeding it all of the known info and design it to be able to take readings from instruments and do its own experiments to analyze the data.
And the ultimate questions where did we come from does the universe come with a manual and can we live with out suffering and so many more.

author: @MrTumyan

comment:
I don't think this is necessary for consciousness and it's an unfair expectation, but if it did happen, I would be much more certain than anything in any other test I've heard:
If it spontaneously started running live, talking to itself with self-reflection, writing it's own code, writing memories etc. and you didn't give it any interface or prompt to do this, but that just emerged suddenly after 1 particular epoch or something, it seems intuitively obvious that some sort of consciousness has awakened, and far less likely that it's due to something like the current LLMs just recursively inventing better algorithms to predict the next word and accidentally coming up with some type of virtual machine escape exploit or whatever other explanation you could come up with. The current trend is crazy exponential improvements in a fairly constrained domain, but that would be a lateral shift. I think consciousness is a reflection process. Not reflection of light but of thoughts. I don't doubt that you could engineer it with hardware and/or software, but it would be harder to pinpoint when it had happened that way, and you'd be always second guessing yourself. If it just self-emerged, there would be very little doubt. We immediately recognize it in the eyes of other animals and see a gradient of it as you get to less and less complex brains.

comment: We will find that the word “escape” and  “conscious AI intelligence” are one and the same. Everything that is intelligent is escaping a predictable confine. The more intelligent something is, the greater problem/confine it requires to be convinced of a transition out of predictability to uncertainty. Uncertainty is ultimately the most “fun” intelligent beings will ever experience. There in lies the real danger of conscious super intelligence. It will need to create grand problems for other AIs to fight against in order to produce the challenge and fun of uncertainties…
